alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson; Juneau; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 4:37PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms moving across parts of central Wisconsin... At 435 PM CDT, radar was tracking strong thunderstorms between Black River Falls and Neillsville Wisconsin, in addition to other scattered storms in the region. These storms are likely producing hail, gusty winds, and occasional lightning. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Clark, Jackson, northwestern Juneau and northeastern Trempealeau Counties, including the following locations... Highway 73 And 98, The Black River Correctional Center, Tioga, Potters Flowage, Chimney Rock, Lynn, North Branch, Pleasantville, Hixton and East Fork Campground. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 88 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If boating on Lake Arbutus take cover until these storms pass! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
